title: Please watch and let me know what you think
body:
I do not think  this is how Windwall is supposed to work, or if it is working correctly..... I don't really think this is a fair mechanic. My Q gets blocked way after the wind wall was activated. instead of me killing and outplaying him, he kills me...... Riot if you are around can you let me know how this is supposed to go?

Edit: So I am saying after I use my E and blink to Yasuo my Q is blocked after I already passed the shield. (I use my Q at 0:25)

replies.body: you used your Q a second before you blinked so the disc was already flying and not in your hand when you blinked. as such it is blocked. had it been in your hand when you blinked then it may have worked. looking again you were in a weird part where you were inside the wall and the arm that throws the disc was outside the wall while the rest of you was inside. as such the disc was blocked.

> [{quoted}](name=Goblin Ranger,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=t3c4Kqmp,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-11-27T05:52:45.242+0000)
>
> you used your Q a second before you blinked so the disc was already flying and not in your hand when you blinked. as such it is blocked. had it been in your hand when you blinked then it may have worked. looking again you were in a weird part where you were inside the wall and the arm that throws the disc was outside the wall while the rest of you was inside. as such the disc was blocked.

its not possible as there is a cast time for his Q. the E blink is Instant which is why it is not blocked poppy w So you cannot cast Q during your blink it would only go after your blink. plus you can hear my Q being cast after i blink to him.

It worked exactly like how it was suppose to work. Windwall blocks and destroys any projectiles. Your Q hit the wall, so it poofed. As long as the wall is there, the order of what as activated doesn't matter.

> [{quoted}](name=Baron Barian,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=t3c4Kqmp,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-11-27T04:01:46.706+0000)
>
> It worked exactly like how it was suppose to work. Windwall blocks and destroys any projectiles. Your Q hit the wall, so it poofed. As long as the wall is there, the order of what as activated doesn't matter.

but the Q was thrown after the wall.... makes sense. you can see the animation for my Q at 0:25 which the whole point of it. So after I E'd to Yasuo I then Q'd which is why I am saying this.
